1. quando si . . . cognoscitis, Ooynosoere here bears its technical meaning of ‘ examining judicially into a criminal case before a· tribunal!

2. homicidae, vel sacrilegi, etc. Each of these criminal charges (elogia, tituli, see next note) was fastened upon the Christians by their enemies: comp. below, ‘ Christianum hominem omnium scelerum reum? etc.

3. ut de nostris elogiis loquar. Eloyium in legal phraseology is ‘ the judicial statement ' or ‘ abstract of the criminal charge ' ε so mittere aliquem cum eloyio,==‘to send a person before the magistrates on a warrant specifying his offence.’ Gomp. ad Scap. 4, ‘ Pudens etiam

missum ad se Christianum in elogio concussione ejus intellecta dimisit, ’

scisso eodem elogio, sine accusatore negans se auditurum hominem, secundum mandatum?
